required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Step-up to Medium Strength Triple Therapy vs High Strength ICS/LABA in Adult Asthmatics Uncontrolled on Medium Strength ICS/LABA
clinical_study.official_title: A 26 Week, Randomized, Double Blind, Multinational, Multicenter, Active Controlled, 2-arm Parallel Group Trial Comparing CHF 5993 100/6/12.5 μg pMDI (Fixed Combination of Extrafine Formulation of Beclometasone Dipropionate Plus Formoterol Fumarate Plus Glycopyrronium Bromide) to CHF 1535 22/6 μg pMDI (Fixed Combination of Extrafine Formulation of Beclometasone Dipropionate Plus Formoterol Fumarate) in Subjects With Asthma Uncontrolled on Medium Doses of Inhaled Corticosteroids in Combination With Long-Acting β2-Agonists

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this phase IV Study is to demonstrate the efficacy of CHF5993 (BDP/FF/GB 100/6/12.5 pMDI) on uncontrolled asthma subjects, compared to CHF1535 (BDP/FF 200/6 pMDI)

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects exhibiting no Airflow Obstruction on average over 26 weeks of treatment in the study sub-population with Airflow Obstruction status at screening
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of subjects exhibiting on average Airflow Obstruction negative (AO-) status over 26 weeks of treatment in the study sub-population with Airflow Obstruction positive (AO+) status at screening. A subject is defined as AO+ at screening if post-bronchodilator (salbutamol) FEV1/FVC ratio is < 0.7. A subject is defined as AO- during the treatment period if the mean of their 3 hour post-dose FEV1/FVC ratio collected during the treatment period is ≥ 0.7

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in pre-dose FEV1 at Week 26

arm_group.description: 2 inhalations BID, Daily dose is 400/24/50 μg
2 inhalations BID, Daily dose is 800/24 μg

intervention.intervention_name: Administration via pressurized metered dose inhaler (pMDI)
